content: There are plenty of peace signs so it’s presumably some sort of anti-war demonstration. And the final moment of handing the police officer a Pepsi echoes the 60s demonstrations where people handed flowers to the officers. But I agree that it’s excessively vague. Pepsi is trying to associate itself with social justice movements while failing to take a stand on any social justice issues. That’s what this article, and so many people, are objecting to. They’re trying to get the benefit of association without taking any of the risks that are associated with being part of a real movement.
